front: Explain the difference between hardware and software.
back:
• Hardware is the physical components that make up a computer system.
  • Software is the code that is *executed* on top of / makes use of the hardware.

front: Explain the difference between system software and application software.
back:
• System software provides to the user a layer of abstraction from the hardware.
  • Application software is used to carry out user-oriented tasks.

What are libraries and why are they used?
back:
Libraries are collections of routines that can be used in a program.
They are used because:
  • They are *reliable*, well tested and secure.
  • They save time for programmers who will not have to write the code that libraries provide.
  • They can allow programmers to use operations that they would not know how to make for themselves.

front: What are utility programs used for? Give examples.
back:
Utility programs are used to perform a management/maintenance function of a computer.
Some examples include:
  • Disk defragmentation software.
  • Virus checking software.
  • Encryption software.
  • Compression software.
  • Backup software.

What is the role of an operating system?
back: The role of an operating system is to hide the complexities of the hardware from the user.

front: What physical resources does an operating system manage?
back:
• Processor (schedules processes)
  • Memory (allocates memory to processes)
  • I/O Devices (allocates to processes)
  • Secondary Storage (allocates space for files)
  • Cache
  • Power Supply / Battery Management

front: Describe the functions of an operating system.
back:
• The role of an operating system is to hide the complexities of the hardware from the user.
  • The operating system will schedule processes to be executed on the processor.
  • The operating system will allocate space in memory for processes to use.
  • The operating system will allocate I/O devices to processes.
  • The operating system will allocate space in secondary storage to store files in.
  • The operating system will handle interrupts using an appropriate interrupt service routine (ISR) when they occur.
  • The operating system will manage the power supply or battery controller.
  • The operating system may be responsible for automatic updates of the system software.
